pr_title: Implementation of MP FT 2.1.1 using FT SE

timeline.message:
Initial prototype with basic support for fallback, retry and asynchronous. Passing unit tests FallbackTest, RetryTest and AsynchronousTest.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Allow conversion to CompletionStage with completeWithoutValue flag.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Create Single's with nullMeansEmpty flag to handle void methods. Modified ErrorChecker to use subtyping instead of equality when comparing exceptions.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Several improvements for circuit breakers. Handler creation for all FT annotations.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Trying new implementation of timeout when running on same thread.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Updates to CommandRunner and ThrowableMapper.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Improvements to better support sync and async timeouts.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Improved handling of exceptions in async calls.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Threshold compared using greater-than instead of greater-or-equal.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Changes in this commit:

 - Support for sync (no queues) in Bulkhead
 - Fixed validation in FallbackAntn
 - Fixes to CommandRunner async support
 - Some changes in unit tests while preserving coverage

 All unit tests for Timeout, Fallback, Retry, Asynchronous, Bulkhead and CircuitBreaker are passing.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Changes in this commit:

 - Support for metrics for all primitives except bulkheads
 - Changes to SE Retry to count number of retries
 - Some test fixes

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Changes in this commit:

 - New method in Bulkhead to return stats
 - Support for all metrics related to bulkheads
 - Some minor test changes

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Bulkhead metrics improved.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Removed all Hystrix and Failsafe code and dependencies.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Upgraded to FT 2.1 API. Fixed checkstyle and copyright problems.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed used of duration units in Retry.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Support for request scope propagation for CDI and Jersey. In the FT TCKs, only the CDI request scope is active. Temporarily disable annotation validation in CDI extension as this now causes TCKs to fail validation before running.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Changes to ErrorChecker to implement MP semantics. First checks skipOn and then applyOn sets. Updates to some tests.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Handle somewhat unusual case of synchronous method returning a CompletionStage<?>.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Changes in this commit:

 - Handle timeouts when a method catches InterruptedException
 - Changes to SE FT to support some event listeners
 - Create handlers for each invocation while sharing those for Bulkheads and CircuitBreakers
 - Renamed CommandRunner to MethodInvoker

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Handle TestNG before and after methods.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Added toString() method to help debugging.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Improved implementations of MethodInvoker and TimeoutImpl.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Async methods cannot throw exceptions. Fixed return type.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Use FT 2.1.1.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

New implementation for async that also simplifies the sync case.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Renamed async to currentThread.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed returned types of async methods in tests.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Enhanced support for asynchronous methods.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed regression in request scope support.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Support for cancellation of Singles created from CompletableFutures and vice-versa.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Support for cancellation of async tasks. Update ResultWindow opening condition to use '>' instead of '>=' for MP compatibility. Made some test changes.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Use CompletableFuture instead of Future whenever possible. CircuitBreaker's opening window condition.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Config property to disable caching of MethodState's. New logic to support task cancellations.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Handle multiple applications with different CCL as required by the TCKs.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Map exception types in applyOn and failOn from MP to SE. This is necessary for proper semantics of breakers, retry and bulkheads, and their combinations.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Re-organized FT handlers to run the timeout handler first.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Updated semantics for circuit breakers. Thresholds are checked after collecting more results than the window size. Several TCK tests were failing due to incorrect semantics. Some tests have been updated.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Restored validation of FT annotations.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed problems with fallback and breaker metrics.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Bulkhead histograms should only be registered for async methods. Entries should only be recorded for scheduled tasks.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

New class to use as key into the method states map. Key must include class loader (TCKs), class (method inheritance) and method. The class is necessary since the same method can be inherited by multiple classes with different annotations.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Use executor from FT SE after adjusting core sizes. Set queue to 0 for sync bulkheads.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Switched composition of handlers for bulkhead and circuit breakers.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Ensure proper access to context class loader to access application's config while running the TCKs.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Invert timeout and bulkhead handlers. Timeouts also apply to tasks waiting in bulkhead queue.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

On timeout also cancel source single.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

New instance of SingleNever for every invocation. It is otherwise possible for an old timeout to interrupt a new invocation on same thread.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Clean up tck-suite file.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed copyright and checkstyle issues.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Merge branch 'master' into ft-2.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Revert "On timeout also cancel source single."

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Make sure source is cancelled when multi is cancelled.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Remove old files.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Async flag is no longer needed.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Updated comment.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Removed unused listener support.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

More cleanup of unused flags.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed checkstyle errors.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed Javadoc.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Copyright year.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Adjusted breaker window and error ratio based on latest changes.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

timeline.author: danielkec

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't look right. I think Single operators are still immutable and create a new instance, thus returing single will not have the cancel operation. You'd probably want return single.onCancel(() -> taskFuture.cancel(true));.
timeline.author: akarnokd

replies.bodyText: I discussed this with @danielkec. Code works because of how we interact with Future but returning the Single from onCancel is the correct way. Fixed.
replies.author: spericas

timeline.message:
Use Single returned from onCancel. Minor optimization.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericasgeertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

timeline.bodyText: There is a reason for copying the sets - this method is called from a builder, which has mutable properties. This should work only on the data at the point the method was called and should ignore future mutation of these sets.
timeline.author: tomas-langer

Make sure that tests are copied due to mutability.
